result.execSummary:
The defendant Russ A Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (<120 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(3).
  • Failure to Support Child (<120 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(3).
  • Failure to Support Child (<120 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(3).
  • Failure to Support Child (<120 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jackson County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any probation now serving.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  If the defendant is placed on probation or released to extended supervision, IT IS ORDERED that the defendant pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
Obtain, maintain and report full time employment.  Provide pay stubs to his agent according to his pay schedule.  Not to terminate his employment without his agent's prior approval.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

Strictly comply with any child support orders, as amended from time to time, in the State of Wisconsin.  Maintain regular contact with his child support worker.

Credit for 32 days if revoked.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: A civil judgment is ordered for unpaid court ordered financial obligations.
May serve in Eau Claire County Jail.  Huber allowed according to jail rules.

records.addlTxt: of JOCR, corrected JOCR and JFFO.    Return to Sender.  Refused.    Unable to Forward.  No longer at this address.

records.descr: Corrected Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: District Attorney Daniel S. Diehn appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Sebion.  Parties have the revocation packet.  No corrections or changes noted.  Victim notification complied with.   State recommended:  6 months jail, each count concurrent.  72 days sentence credit.  Judgment for unpaid court ordered financial obligations.  Defense leaves sentence up to the court. Requesting to serve with huber, in Eau Claire County.   Defendant  exercised his right to allocution.  Court ordered:  9 months jail, each count concurrent.  72 days sentence credit.  May serve in Eau Claire County Jail.  Huber allowed according to jail rules.  Judgment for unpaid court ordered financial obligations.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 11, 2018 at 03:30 pm.
and Revocation Summary (sent to Judge)
From DOC along with revocation packet

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DNA submission form

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Terrien.  Defendant plead no contest to 4 amended counts of misdemeanor failure to support child.  2 years probation each count concurrent.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties on the counts he plead to.  Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant. Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his pleas and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Found guilty of 4 counts of misdemeanor failure to support child, contrary to 948.22(3).  Joint recommendation for 2 years probation.  Obtain and maintain and report full time employment.  Not to terminate.  I&S 90 days jail with  32 days credit.  Strictly comply with child support orders, as amended from time to time 08PA21.   The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  CC, DNA sample.  Attorney Terrien says defendant has an additional 28 days credit.  Attorney Terrien will look into that further.   

Court ordered:  sentence withheld, 2 years probation, each count concurrent.  Obtain, maintain and report full time employment.  Provide pay stubs to his agent according to his pay schedule.  Not to terminate without his agent's prior approval.    Strictly comply with any child support orders, as amended from time to time,  in the State of Wisconsin.  Maintain regular contact with his child support worker.     The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  CC, DNA sample and surcharge.  If revoked, 32 days credit.
STC canceled and set for PLEAS at request of Atty Terrien.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 2, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.  Attorney Terrien appeared in court.  Request by defense to signature bond.  State objects.  Some cash required.  Court denied request to modify bond.  Continued as previously ordered.
Status conference on November 7, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared through Attorney Terrien.  She was just appointed.  STC set for 11/7 at 3 pm.
destroyed
Status conference on October 10, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
He must keep in contact with Jackson County Child Support Agency.
Defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.  Defendant FTA, because no ride.  Will need to reapply for SPD representation.  Do so as soon as possible.
On morning emailed jail sheet
body only
DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant did not appear for the plea/sentencing hearing.  Attorney Sebion appeared.  Warrant authorized.

Russ Peterson called @ 1:20 p.m. bad reception wants to appear by phone or VTC he said; he can not get ahold of attorney because he has bad reception; I asked how does he think he can appear by phone with bad reception; oh he would go to his neighbor down the road and use their phone; suggest he go down there and call his attorney
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 27, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
SPD Carly Sebion appears on behalf of her client.   She states he is in Clark County Jail.  Case can be set for plea/sent.  DA will need to do Writ.  Attorney Sebion to schedule.
Russ Peterson must keep in contact with Jackson County Child Support Agency
1 and 2

Pre-trial conference on May 18, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on June 6, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Information filed with the court.  Waive reading of the information.  NGP entered.  PTC set for 5/18 and STC 6/6 at 3 pm.  Defendant does not to appear at the STC unless he has been released from custody.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Sebion.  State called L.G. from the Jackson County Child Support Agency.  Sworn by the clerk.  Manager for CSA.  Worked for CSA since 1998.  Actions that are taken if someone doesn't pay child support outlined by L.G.  Defendant ordered to pay $193.00 child support monthly starting 2/1/09.  Past payments reviewed.  Judicial notice of 08PA21.  Defense cross examined the witness.  Amount of arrears.  Exhibit 1 marked.  Child Support event history report marked as Exhibit 2.  State redirect.  Exhibits 1 and 2 admitted.  Probable cause found.
Subpoena and Certificate of Appearance served on L.G. to appear at 4/26 preliminary hearing
Defendant appeared by video from the Clark County Jail.
$1,000 signature bond set.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the Clark County Jail.  Attorney Sebion appeared in court.  Reading of the complaint waived.  Attorney Sebion requested a preliminary hearing be scheduled within time limits.
faxed bond to Clark Cty SO
Russ Peterson must keep in contact with Jackson County Child Support Agency
Preliminary hearing on April 26, 2016 at 04:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 15, 2016 at 10:30 am.
DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Attorney Sebion appeared.  Schedule by VTC.  Attorney Sebion to speak to JA to arrange.
Eau Claire County jail called.  Defendant is currently in custody there.
Russ's mom called he currently is being held in Eau Claire Cty Jail
